Jim Preston.Action: Listed as a Rate 2 Mechanical Engineer, indicating formal technical training and a professional background in engineering.
Greets the video stewardess with a scowl and rubs his eyes, showing confusion and irritation rather than friendliness or warmth.
Wakes up from suspended animation and responds to the stewardess video with awareness, recalling context.

Takes his pills and nutrient juice as instructed to recover from hibernation despite grimacing, follows instructions to put on robe and slippers, takes shipcard and wears it around his neck, thanks the video stewardess courteously, follows directions to find his cabin (takes Elevator D to deck seven).
Greets the cleaning robot with a startled but polite 'Hello, robot.'
Responds with 'Thanks.' and 'Jim' when addressed politely by the cargo robot.
Eagerly opens the door at the doorbell sound but feels deflated when no one is there.
Follows wall markings to his cabin and settles in efficiently.
Responds politely but somewhat startled when greeted by the cleaning robot.
Does not pay attention to important onboarding announcements on the screen.
Swipes shipcard correctly without confusion to retrieve his luggage from the cargo robot.
Raises his hand to ask a question during the orientation, showing engagement and initiative.
Appears to be alone and sits quietly, waiting patiently for others to arrive.
Arrives early and attends the group orientation session alone, despite no one else showing up yet.
Attempts to ask questions during the video instructor's presentation but is told to wait until the end.
Repeatedly seeks help and information from automated sources, trying to communicate with a person in charge.
Expresses frustration and confusion loudly (exploding) when alone and unable to find others.
Asks clear, direct questions about the situation and seeks reliable information despite confusing or incomplete responses.
Uses available technological resources (Infomat) to gather information and locate responsible personnel on the ship.
Expresses impatience or frustration abruptly (exploding with question) which may indicate a lack of initial composure.
Finds the Ship Steward's office and quickly assesses the situation as negative upon seeing it empty and unused, showing situational awareness.
Urgently seeks the Captain during an emergency, pounding on the secure hatch, showing concern for the situation.
Calls out repeatedly in empty public spaces with panic in his voice, showing desperation and hope for connection or help.
Asks clear questions to the Infomat to gather information about who is flying the ship and where to find the Captain.
Marches off confidently toward the Command Deck and attempts to open the door to the Bridge.
Pounds on the secure hatch after finding the Bridge deserted, showing persistence in trying to gain access.
Runs frantically through various decks calling out for help, displaying panic.
Notices and briefly reacts to the robot window-washer but does not engage further or attempt to seek help from it.
Moves into the Observatory and interacts with the control podium, attempting to use the starship's information display.
Shows impatience when the observatory does not answer his questions promptly.
Expresses horror and confusion upon realizing he woke up too soon, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Frantically searches for his hibernation pod and attempts to open it, demonstrating concern for himself but no harmful intent toward others.
Responds to Infomat's help with 'Bite me.'
Makes an emergency recorded message calmly explaining his situation and asking for help.
Uses Infomat terminal to inquire about making a long-distance call despite limited knowledge.
Gives up on formal instructions and walks away annoyed after getting a helpful map but no direct solution.
Attempts to use the communications booth card reader and navigates through options to contact Earth, showing some adaptability.
Admits he doesn't know the exact phone number but attempts to identify a relevant department based on emergency needs.
Appears panicked and momentarily frozen ('deer in the headlights') when asked to begin message recording but quickly collects himself and communicates clearly.
Asks for help politely ('Could use a hand. Thanks.')
Expresses visible devastation at bad news ('DEVASTATED')
Keeps trying to fix the communication problem despite difficulty.
Asks for help despite being alone and in crisis, showing self-awareness.
Sits back in his chair after sending the message, waiting calmly.
Reacts with devastation to the news of the 55-year delay.
Crosses the Concourse like a sleepwalker, looking shell-shocked.
Interacts curiously with Arthur the android, inspecting the bar and android's structure.
Introduces himself politely, shakes hands with Arthur.
Expresses vulnerability and worry about his situation being awake early; admits he is in trouble and 'completely, ridiculously screwed.'
Challenges Arthur with questions about the ship and his premature awakening, showing persistence and sincerity.
Questions Arthur about the ship and the hibernation system, demonstrating curiosity and critical thinking.
Accepts Arthur's dismissive attitude without seeking further technical expertise or solutions.
Recognizes and vocalizes the gravity of his situation, showing situational awareness.
Relies on self-pity and expresses defeat openly, which may indicate emotional vulnerability affecting problem-solving ability.
Shakes head in surrender when asked if he will live or lie down and die.
Browses various ship facilities alone, showing curiosity but no social interaction.
Ignores 'No Passengers beyond this point' sign and enters Crew Area without hesitation.
Jim breezes past the 'No Passengers beyond this point' sign to access the crew area without hesitation.
Jim eagerly explores the command deck, opens emergency gear cabinets, and pulls out technical manuals to study, demonstrating initiative and resourcefulness.
Jim shows frustration but also adaptability when the coffee machine denies him the premium coffee, quickly selecting an alternative.
Jim shakes his head in surrender when asked if he's going to live or die, indicating a momentary lack of resolve or decisiveness.
Carefully organizes and retrieves personal belongings, including a toolbox, showing responsibility for his things.
When trapped inside the pod, he eventually calms down and uses the emergency release to free himself, demonstrating self-control and resourcefulness.
Initially loses composure and rages while trapped, pounding and shouting, showing frustration but also vulnerability.
Attempts many times to break into the crew hibernation facility showing persistence but no aggression toward crew.
Sits quietly at the bar with Arthur drinking whiskey and opens up about his struggles and feelings of being lost.
Looks thoughtfully at Arthur while they talk, showing openness to interaction and sincerity.
Attempts multiple methods including toolbox tools, laser cutter, axe, sledgehammer, jackhammer, drill, and crowbar to breach the door, demonstrating persistence and varied technical approaches.
Fails to open the door after extensive effort over weeks, the door remains secure despite his attempts.
Shows signs of frustration and exhaustion, drinking whiskey and acknowledging his inability to find a solution.
Systematically escalates efforts from simple tool use to advanced equipment like industrial laser cutter, showing planning and resourcefulness.
Listens thoughtfully to Arthur's advice about living in the present and tries to engage in playful behavior by spinning on the barstool.
Considers Arthur's philosophical point about being in the right place thoughtfully.
Listens to advice to take a break and attempts to have fun by spinning on his barstool.
Misses the shove and falls off the stool.
Uses a cargo robot effectively to carry his tools and luggage into a suite.

Carefully unpacks and arranges mementos in his room.
Orders food with relish, showing enjoyment and engagement.
Enjoys challenging a game and shows enthusiasm despite losing.
Expresses elation and excitement after winning at the arcade game, 'Z Factor.'
Practices basketball alone intensely, showing no social interaction or engagement with others.
Drinks multiple margaritas alone in the cantina, suggesting possible loneliness or withdrawal.
Learns a new language by himself in the library, indicating self-improvement but no social warmth.
Attempts to speak in Russian and engage with Arthur in conversation, showing openness to new relationships.
Tries new drinks as suggested by Arthur, showing willingness to be social and try new experiences.
Drinks alone and appears to be sinking into isolation, showing withdrawal from social interaction.
Sits alone in cafeteria staring at nothing, indicating emotional detachment and lack of engagement with others.
Sits at a workstation actively taking a Russian language course, repeating phrases correctly.
Attempts to speak Russian in a bar while drunk, using poor grammar ('I be study the Russian').
Expresses a willingness to try new things, such as ordering a different drink every time he sits down.
Reacts poorly to a new drink by making a horrible face, showing a candid but perhaps lacking tact response.
Shows signs of neglecting self-care (hasn't shaved in weeks, puts on weight), appearing listless and unmotivated.
Sits sipping coffee and staring at nothing, appears disengaged and passive.
Thumps fist on bar demanding a new drink from the robot bartender.
Touches the holographic singer's face with tenderness before she dissolves.
Sits alone in photo booth producing expressionless pictures despite promotional images of joyful people.
Punches his name into the high scores board, indicating familiarity and confidence with the Z-Factor machine.
Speaks fluent Russian to the robot bartender, showing linguistic ability and willingness to engage.
Thumps his fist on the bar and demands a new drink, demonstrating frustration but also assertiveness.
Fails to generate or find any new cocktails after trying all 2,738 options, indicating limits of resourcefulness or adaptability.
Touches the holographic lounge singer’s face, failing to recognize the illusion’s boundaries immediately.
Shows emotional and physical reactions of loneliness and numbness, withdrawing from surroundings and stimuli.
Navigates the hazardous Robotics Center carefully, showing renewed interest and awareness.
Sits blindly on the sweeper robot, indicating absent-mindedness or lack of awareness of surroundings.
Interacts playfully and attentively with the sweeper robot, feeding it chips in a rhythmic way.
Waves and gets a non-verbal response from Arthur at the Concourse Bar, showing social awareness and confidence.
Acknowledges Aurora's intelligence and courage, speaks respectfully about her.
Ignores housekeeping, lets suite stay messy, avoids interaction with housekeeping robot.
Searches for detailed information about Aurora Dunn to learn about her background and work.
Reads and analyzes articles to understand complex topics such as corporate ownership.
Shows disorganized living habits; messy suite with laundry and dishes on the floor, indicates neglect of personal upkeep.
Uses the 'Do Not Disturb' function to avoid housekeeping interruptions, showing some planning and control.
Emerges in boxer shorts and slippers with a blanket wrapped around him, holding cereal awkwardly, suggesting lack of typical social or personal grooming awareness.
Stares at Aurora with deep longing and talks about falling for her, expressing vulnerability and emotional honesty.
Engages Arthur in a philosophical conversation about loneliness and companionship, showing thoughtfulness and consideration.
Lays his head on the bar in resignation, showing emotional struggle but no hostility or bitterness towards others.
Reads the hibernation systems manual and attempts to engage Arthur in thoughtful conversation about difficult ethical choices.
Shows emotional vulnerability and distraction by staring at Aurora while eating, indicating preoccupation rather than practical focus.
Expresses concern about waking Aurora because it would strand her alone on the ship for life.
Responds to Arthur's machine nature with frustration and stalks away.
States confidently that he knows how to wake up Aurora, showing knowledge and determination.
Expresses frustration and uncertainty about the consequences of his knowledge, leading to indecision and worry.
Buries face in hands and questions what to do, implying overwhelmed and unsure how to proceed.
Walks around ship thoughtfully, exploring faith rooms and the E.V.A. Room, possibly gathering information and seeking perspective.
Raises his arms imploring the heavens for an answer, showing vulnerability and sincere yearning.
Talks to himself while shaving off his beard, reflecting internal conflict and self-awareness.
Steps confidently into the airlock, dons a spacesuit, uses magnetic boots to walk on the ship's hull and across the skylight.
Hesitates with lifted arms imploring the cosmos for an answer but receives none, showing some internal confusion or passivity.
Shaves off his beard despite feeling it is 'wrong' and admonishing himself, showing a moment of internal conflict but decisive action.
Carries toolbox and uses the 'PLEASE SERVICE' button to summon housekeeping robots efficiently.
Refers to a densely annotated technical manual he prepared himself, showing prior study and preparation.
Follows technical steps carefully to repair and restart Aurora's pod despite visible nervousness (hands shaking).
Hesitates briefly before completing the final circuit, showing caution and awareness.
Pulls hands away as if burned by the circuit, possibly indicating uncertainty or discomfort with the technical work.
After repair, quickly cleans up and hides evidence of his manual, indicating concern about others knowing about his reliance on the manual.
Appears wild-eyed and stressed after the repair task, suggesting emotional strain but not necessarily incompetence.
Rises from his cabin and searches for Aurora, pacing nervously and actively trying to locate her.
Greets Aurora warmly and loudly in an attempt to get her attention amidst her confusion.
Steps out warily of his cabin, looks cautiously up and down the hall.
Rushes to railing and calls out to Aurora eagerly but nervously.
Runs down six flights of stairs eagerly to respond to Aurora's call, showing attentiveness and readiness to connect.
Introduces himself sincerely, sticks out hand for a handshake, and is visibly affected by the interaction (electric for Jim).
Tries to explain the situation about the sleeping crew and the difficulty without becoming defensive or evasive.
Struggles to deliver bad news about the crew situation, showing vulnerability and concern.

Runs down six flights of stairs quickly to reach Aurora, showing physical capability and urgency.
Calmly explains the situation about the crew still sleeping and not accessible, providing clear information despite the stress.

Yanks his eyes away from Aurora's neck when she looks at him.

Explains clearly to Aurora the limitations of the hibernation pods and the current situation regarding their wakefulness.

Responds openly and shares detailed information about efforts to contact others despite the long odds.

Keeps a secret from Aurora about waking her up, to protect her feelings.

Keeps a secret about waking Aurora up from hibernation when she believes it was an accident, showing discretion.

Acknowledges his limitations frankly and does not pretend to have more knowledge than he possesses.

Passive behavior when Aurora presses him to keep looking and takes her fruit salad instead of engaging further.

Proposes a logical starting point for investigation by focusing on the initial failures from the day he woke up.
Uses Gus's crew card to access a secured area (engine room) confidently and without hesitation.
Peers at gauges to assess the Power Converter and makes an informed comment that it seems okay.
Enters reactor control room cautiously with Aurora, advising to not touch anything, showing awareness and carefulness in a sensitive environment.
Grabs Aurora as she is sucked into the room by a hurricane-force wind, tries to protect her.
Propping the door open with a hammer to prevent it from closing and trapping Aurora.
Initially warns Aurora not to open the door, showing concern for her safety.
Explains complex technical systems (fusion reactor, gravity plant) clearly and confidently to Aurora.
Notices potential issue with door lock before it opens, indicating cautious consideration.
Uses a hammer to prop open the door against strong wind, showing quick thinking and resourcefulness.
Pulls Aurora loose from the column and shoves her toward the door to help her escape, risking his own safety.
Fights the wind and clings for his life while holding the metal drawer as a shield, showing self-preservation but also determination to survive for a reason (implied care).
Uses the steel drawer and epoxy foam to seal the hull breach, risking his own safety.
Relies on Aurora to resuscitate him after losing consciousness.
Brainstorms the cause of ship system failures and devises a solution to prevent total breakdown.
Keeps calm and works collaboratively with Aurora to fix the ship's critical systems under pressure.
Does not show any dismissive or selfish behavior during crisis, focuses on teamwork and technical repair.
The computers are networked and overloaded after the core computer failure; Jim correctly identifies the cause and the chain reaction leading to total failure.
Proposes that replacing the core computer will stop the cascading burnouts and save the ship, demonstrating problem-solving and understanding of system dependencies.
Drives the golf cart at high speed to retrieve the replacement part, showing urgency and decisiveness.
Uncrates the replacement computer and attempts installation alongside Aurora, following technical manuals and notes.
Ignores advice to rest and insists he is fine despite apparent exhaustion.
Sleeps deeply and undisturbed, allowing Aurora space and privacy without intrusion.
Immediately tries to reach and save Aurora who is helplessly drifting in zero gravity, shows concern for her safety.
Explains the situation about the failing gravity plant patiently to Aurora to keep her informed and calm.
Spots his tool belt floating in mid-air, retrieves it efficiently, and proceeds to open the door to find Aurora.
Propels himself skillfully through zero gravity by using handholds to navigate the promenade.
Quickly recognizes the danger of lack of gravity and the failing gravity plant; explains the technical situation calmly to Aurora.
Takes immediate physical action by diving at Aurora like Superman to catch her before she drifts away further.
Moves decisively toward fixing the core computer to mitigate the failing systems.
Takes Aurora's hand and works together with her to replace the core computer under dangerous conditions.
Supports Aurora by physically cooperating and sharing effort during a crisis.

Jim and Aurora skillfully maneuver in zero gravity, handle the heavy and delicate core computer replacement, disconnect the ruined computer, and install the new one under extreme conditions with warning alarms and reactor failure.
Works collaboratively and calmly with Aurora to fix the computer during a crisis.
Responds to Aurora's laughter about being alive with curiosity and openness.
Allows Aurora to slide her arm around his waist, indicating comfort and receptiveness.

Efficiently connects multiple cables despite the ship shuddering violently, carefully follows Aurora's instruction, completes the task by lowering clamps and flipping the power lever, restoring power and gravity.
Admits not knowing what is happening after the computer reboot.
Immediately thinks ahead about replacing other burned-out computers, showing situational awareness and planning.
Rushes to the hibernation bay and tries to stop the ejection of pods containing people.
Acknowledges urgency but admits he is not fast enough to save all pods.
Rushes to a console, quickly scans display to diagnose the problem — the hibernation system rebooted and is ejecting pods.
Works with a power driver to remove the pod panel, attempting to stop the pods from ejecting.
Not fast enough to stop the pod before it ejects into space.
Immediately identifies the person inside a critical pod as the Captain and assesses the urgency.
Expresses that he has missed Aurora and takes her hand, intertwining fingers.
Engages sincerely in a mutual moment of reconciliation and affection with Aurora.
